clinical_study.brief_title: The Search for Viral and Bacterial Etiology of Varicocele
clinical_study.official_title: The Search for Viral and Bacterial Etiology of Varicocele

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to answer the question is there any relationship between viral ( HSV 1 , HSV 2 , HPV 6/11, CMV, HHV 6 , HHV 8, BKV) or bacterial (Porphyromonas gingivalis, Treponema denticola, Tannerella forsythia, Fusobacterium nucleatum) infection and occurrence of varicocele in men.

primary_outcome.measure: Level of presence od viral or bacterial infection, level of expression of SHH and VEGF in varicose vein wall. .
primary_outcome.description: Qualitative and quantitive analysis (presence and concentration - µl or U/µl in two different laboratory tests.) to detect genetic material (DNA, mRNA) of bacteria/viruses will be performed. The outcomes from both gropus will be compared.

arm_group.description: 20 patients with varicocele (grade II or III) undergoing subinguinal microsurgery varicocelectomy due to infertility and/or pain in the scrotum.
20 patients (without varicocele) undergoing open hernia repair.

intervention.description: During the procedure approximately 1cm long fragment of varicose vein will be taken for further investigation.
During the procedure approximately 1cm long fragment of spermatic cord vein will be taken for further investigation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- in experimental arm - varicocele grade II or III and infertility and/or pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- in control arm: presence of varicocele in ultrasound before surgery
